detail_description: Kota Barrage is a popular tourist destination located in the city of Kota, India. It is a dam built on the Chambal River and serves as a picturesque spot for visitors to enjoy scenic views and recreational activities. The barrage offers stunning panoramic views of the river and surrounding landscapes, making it a favorite spot for nature lovers and photography enthusiasts. Visitors can also indulge in boating and other water-based activities at this serene location.
name: Kota Barrage
address: Kota, Rajasthan, India

excerpt: Historic reservoir with Jag Mandir palace in the center & replicas of the 7 Wonders of the World.
detail_description: Kishore Sagar, located in Kota, Rajasthan, India, is a historic reservoir featuring the picturesque Jag Mandir palace situated on an island within the lake. The area also boasts replicas of the Seven Wonders of the World at Seven Wonder Park and other attractions like Rao Madho Singh Museum and Garadia Mahadev Temple offering stunning views of the Chambal River gorge.
name: Kishore Sagar
address: Gumanpura, Kota, Rajasthan

excerpt: Housed in a 13th-century palace, this museum displays weapons, armor, textiles, art, regalia & more.
detail_description: City Palace Garh in Kota is a stunning 13th-century palace that showcases the grandeur of Rajput architecture with its Mughal and Rajasthani design elements. The museum within the palace houses an impressive collection of artifacts including royal garments, weapons, and artwork, offering a glimpse into Kota's regal history.
name: City Palace Garh, Kota
address: Tipta, SH 33, Kishorepura Darwaja, Garh Palace, Kota, Rajasthan 324006, India

detail_description: The Seven Wonders Park in Kota offers a unique experience with its miniature replicas of the Seven Wonders of the World. It's a great place for families and children to explore and learn about these iconic landmarks. The park provides an opportunity to capture stunning photos, featuring picturesque views, including the Jag Mahal and natural surroundings. Visitors are advised to stay hydrated due to the park's size, especially if accompanied by children. Additionally, it has been used as a filming location for various productions.
name: Seven wonders park
address: 5VH2+QJ5, Kota Thermal Power Station Colony, Electricity Board Area, Kota, Rajasthan 324008, India

name: GODAVARI DHAM BALAJI TEMPLE
address: Rawat Bhata Rd, Waqf Nagar, Shivpura, Kota, Rajasthan 324009, India

detail_description: Immerse yourself in the rich history of Kota by visiting the Brij Vilas Palace Government Museum. Housed within the grand Brij Vilas Palace, this museum offers a fascinating glimpse into the royal past of Kota. From ancient coins and historical artifacts to sculptures and old documents, it's a treasure trove of cultural heritage. The museum also showcases items used by the royals, including weaponry, manuscripts, paintings, and traditional attire.
name: Brij Vilas Palace Government Museum
address: Chatra Vilas Garden, Nayapura, Kota, Rajasthan 324001, India

excerpt: Tourist attraction featuring mini replicas of 7 wonders of the world, including the Eiffel Tower.
detail_description: Seven Wonders Park, located in Kota, Rajasthan, India, is a popular tourist attraction featuring miniature replicas of the world's seven wonders. Situated along the picturesque Kishore Sagar Lake at Vallabh Bari, this unique park allows visitors to marvel at meticulously crafted models of iconic structures such as the Taj Mahal and Eiffel Tower without leaving Kota.
name: Seven Wonders Park
address: Kotri Mini Flyover, Ballabhbari, Gumanpura, Kota, Rajasthan 324006, India

excerpt: Landscaped gardens featuring a pond with a suspension bridge & a miniature train.
detail_description: Chambal Garden is a serene escape from the city, offering a picturesque setting with lush greenery and a beautiful river as its backdrop. Visitors can stroll along pathways, have a picnic, or simply relax while taking in the views. The garden features a pond with a suspension bridge and even has a miniature train for added charm. While it may be an older park compared to newer ones, it remains popular among locals and tourists alike for its tranquil ambiance and scenic river views.
name: Chambal Garden
address: Nagar Nigam, Rawatbhata Rd, Kota, Rajasthan 324009, India

detail_description: Khade Ganesh Ji Mandir, located in Kota, is a significant religious site with a history dating back over 600 years. The temple complex offers a serene and divine experience, filled with the soothing sounds of hymns and the fragrance of incense. The intricate architecture, vibrant colors, and detailed carvings captivate visitors as they make their way to the sanctum sanctorum. Here, an ancient standing sculpture of Lord Ganesha can be found.
name: Khade Ganesh Ji Mandir
address: ward No.5, MBS Road, Ganesh Nagar, 1449, Vinoba Bhave Nagar, Kota, Rajasthan 324010, India

name: Chambal garden
address: 6V77+GWC, Ladpura, Tilak Nagar, Nayapura, Kota, Rajasthan 324002, India

name: Garh Palace
address: Kota, Rajasthan, India

detail_description: Located in the Garh palace, The Rao Madhav Singh Museum is home to a remarkable assortment of Rajput miniature paintings from the Kota school. In addition to these captivating artworks, the museum also showcases an impressive array of sculptures, arms, and other valuable antiques for visitors to admire during their visit.
name: The Rao Madhav Singh Museum
address: 5RFJ+X4G, Garh Palace Kota Rd, Garh Palace, Kota, Rajasthan 324006, India

excerpt: Lakeside, yellow-hued palace & formal gardens, popular for wedding shoots & boating on a pond.
detail_description: Abheda Mahal, located in Kota, Rajasthan, is a stunning palace built by Maharaja Ummed Singh in the 18th century. Situated near the Chambal river, it boasts formal gardens and a picturesque pond with lotus flowers. The palace's architecture and serene surroundings make it an ideal spot for picnics and photography. Visitors can enjoy paddle boating on the pond and may even encounter rabbits on the premises.
name: Abheda Mahal
address: Kota, Rajasthan 323021, India

detail_description: Embark on the Chambal Boat Safari at Kota, Rajasthan for an unforgettable experience. Cruise along the picturesque Chambal River, surrounded by lush greenery, sandy banks, and rugged ravines. During this one-hour safari, marvel at around 300 species of migratory and resident birds while keeping an eye out for Ghariyals and crocodiles in their natural habitat. It's a gateway to exploring nature's wonders and encountering wildlife like never before.
name: Chambal Boat Safari @ Kota
address: C-106, Vallabh Bari, Ballabhbari, Gumanpura, Kota, Rajasthan 324007, India

excerpt: Landmark Hindu temple known for its 525 small statues dedicated to the god Shiva.
detail_description: Shiv Puri Dham, also known as Shri Sankat Mochan Hanuman Mandir, is a significant Hindu temple located in Kota, Rajasthan. The temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva and houses around 525 shiv lingas, making it a unique and sacred site for devotees. Constructed in marble with traditional architecture, the temple's intricate designs and artwork reflect India's rich heritage of craftsmanship.
name: Shiv Puri Dham
address: 324007, Thekra, Kota, Rajasthan 325201, India

excerpt: Park featuring smaller versions of various world wonders, such as the Eiffel Tower & Taj Mahal.
detail_description: Nestled along the picturesque banks of Kishore Sagar Lake in Kota, Rajasthan, the Seven Wonders Park is a delightful destination that showcases miniature replicas of some of the world's most iconic landmarks. Here, you can marvel at stunning versions of the Taj Mahal, Eiffel Tower, Christ the Redeemer, Colosseum, Leaning Tower of Pisa, Great Pyramid of Giza, and Statue of Libertyâ€”all crafted with impressive detail. This park offers a unique opportunity to experience these global wonders without leaving India.
name: Seven Wonder's Park, Kota
address: Kotri Mini Flyover, Ballabhbari, Gaytri Vihar, Kota, Rajasthan 324007, India

excerpt: Street leading to the Khade Ganesh Ji Mandir place of worship, plus restaurants & shops.
detail_description: Khade Ganesh Ji Mandir Rd is a bustling street that leads to the revered Khade Ganesh Ji Mandir, a popular place of worship. The road is lined with various restaurants and shops, offering visitors the opportunity to explore local cuisine and find unique souvenirs. It's a vibrant area where locals and tourists alike can immerse themselves in the cultural and spiritual atmosphere while also enjoying the surrounding amenities.
name: Khade Ganesh Ji Mandir Rd
address: Kota, Rajasthan 324010, India

excerpt: Kota is a city on the Chambal River in Rajasthan, northern India. Inside the Kota Garh, or City Palace, the Maharao Madho Singh Museum exhibits miniature paintings and antique weapons. South, along the river, tranquil Chambal Garden has a pond with crocodiles. Northeast, 18th-century Jagmandir Palace sits in the middle of Kishore Sagar Lake. Seven Wonders Park includes mini replicas of the Eiffel Tower and Taj Mahal.
detail_description: Kota, a city in northern India, is situated on the Chambal River in Rajasthan. The Maharao Madho Singh Museum inside Kota Garh showcases miniature paintings and antique weapons. Along the river, Chambal Garden offers a serene environment with a crocodile pond. In the northeast, Jagmandir Palace stands in Kishore Sagar Lake. Additionally, Seven Wonders Park features miniature replicas of iconic landmarks like the Eiffel Tower and Taj Mahal.
name: Kota
address: Rajasthan, India

excerpt: Small water park featuring a huge outdoor swimming pool, colorful slides & spray zones.
detail_description: Aquagreens Waterpark in Kota is a small but exciting destination for couples and groups looking to cool off and have some fun. With its huge outdoor swimming pool, colorful slides, and spray zones, the park offers a variety of entertainment options. The budget-friendly ticket prices make it an accessible choice for those looking to enjoy a day of thrill and refreshment.
name: Aquagreens Waterpark, Kota
address: Bundi Rd, NH 12, Kota, Rajasthan 324008, India

name: City Mall
address: Unnamed Road, Indraprastha Industrial Area, Kota, Rajasthan 324005, India

detail_description: Shree Nath Ji Charan Chauki is a significant spot located 15 kilometers from Kota City, marking the resting place of Lord Krishna during his journey from Mathura to Dwarka. It is believed that his footprints are preserved at this legendary site. This temple holds historical and religious importance, with devotees worshipping the charan chaap of Thakorji.
name: Shree Nath Ji Charan Chauki
address: 3WWP+MCG, Prahladpura, Rajasthan 325001, India

name: Kansua Shiv Mandir
address: 4VVM+V36, Jk Colony, Kota Industrial Area, Kota, Rajasthan 324004, India

detail_description: Shree Mathuradheesh Ji Temple in Kota is a significant place of worship for devotees of Lord Krishna. Belonging to the Pushti Marg, this temple houses an idol of Krishna brought from Karnaval village near Mathura. The temple celebrates festivals like Janmashtami and Holi with great enthusiasm and offers a peaceful atmosphere for visitors. The darshan timings are convenient, and the devotional songs create a mesmerizing experience.
name: Shree Mathuradheesh Ji Temple
address: 5RHM+4MH, Barrage Road, Patanpole Rd, Rampura, Kota, Rajasthan 324006, India

address: DCM Rd, Ramchandrapura, Dhanmandi, Kota, Rajasthan 324007, India

name: Kota Junction
address: Naya Nohra, Baran Rd, Kota, Rajasthan 325201, India

name: Mahadev Temple
address: 813, Sector - B, Shrinath Puram, Kota, Rajasthan 324010, India

detail_description: Karneshwar Mahadev, a Hindu temple known for its natural beauty, is located near Kota city. It serves as an ideal spot for picnics and attracts many visitors during the rainy season. Families and friends often visit on Sundays to enjoy the serene environment and bathe in the water. The temple, named after Lord Shiva, opens at 6:00 AM and closes at 9:00 PM, offering a breathtaking view of the rising sun.
name: Karneshwar Mahadev
address: 4V23+CM8, Karneshwar Road, Kota Bypass, Kota, Rajasthan 324010, India

detail_description: Chambal Riverfront is a beautifully designed and well-planned destination that offers a captivating experience for visitors. It's recommended to plan a visit with family or friends and allocate at least two to three hours to fully enjoy the various cultural events, including the mesmerizing musical fountain. The evening is an ideal time to visit as the lighting creates a mesmerizing view with reflections in the water.
name: Chambal Riverfront
address: Kalpuriya, Nayapura, Kota, Rajasthan 324001, India

detail_description: Green Pool Farm is a fantastic destination for family outings and kids' birthday parties. The farm offers lush green surroundings, play slides for children, and a refreshing swimming pool that adds to the fun. It's located in a peaceful area attached to Kota, with beautiful views of the main canal. The well-maintained grounds and various recreational activities make it an ultimate picnic and pool party spot for families.
name: Green Pool Farm
address: Canal Rd, Sheenta, Mehrana, Rajasthan 324008, India

detail_description: Entry Gate (Oxygen Park) Kota is a breathtaking destination for nature lovers. The park offers stunning views and well-maintained facilities, including reasonably priced boat rides and a food court with hygienic and affordable options. It's an ideal spot to spend quality time with family or friends, offering peaceful surroundings and numerous amazing viewpoints. While the entry fee could be more budget-friendly, the overall experience is worth it for a tranquil outing in Kota.
name: Entry gate ((oxygen park) kota
address: 4VV3+6CP, Instrumentation Limited Colony, Kota, Rajasthan 324005, India

detail_description: Blue Kingdom Water Park, located in Ballop, offers an awesome and thrilling experience for families. The park features a variety of water slides for both adults and kids, ensuring that everyone can enjoy a fun-filled day. The staff is known for being helpful, while the security guards are vigilant throughout the park. Visitors appreciate the high level of hygiene, excellent locker facilities, and clean washrooms.
name: Blue Kingdom Water Park
address: Ballop, ByPass Road, near Vedant Engineering College, Kota, Rajasthan 323021, India

name: Punit Dham Vatika
address: Keshavpura Government Primary School, Teachers Colony, Mahaveer Nagar, Kota, Rajasthan 324009, India
